news.title: Charlie Kirk shooting suspect’s father told him to turn himself in
Conor McGregor not expected to face prosecution in alleged perjury inquiry
news.summary: Conor McGregor is not expected to face prosecution as part of a criminal inquiry into allegations of perjury related to his civil rape appeal.

news.title: Gardaí arrest man (40s) as part of investigation into Creeslough explosion
news.summary: A man in his 40s has been arrested as part of the investigation into the fatal explosion in Creeslough, Co Donegal in October 2022.

news.title: Man (80s) dies as gardaí investigate Meath hit-and-run
news.summary: A man in his 80s has died after a hit-and-run in Co Meath on Friday morning.

news.title: Twelve babies born alive after pregnancy terminations in 2022, HSE confirms
news.summary: Twelve babies were born alive, following procedures to terminate pregnancy in Ireland in 2022, figures show.

news.title: FAI chief David Courell defends Abbotstown redundancy plans and says Heimir Hallgrimsson will see out contract
news.summary: FAI CEO David Courell says that an above European average spend on staff is the reason the association is set to cut the workforce.

news.title: If Charles and Harry can do it, so can you – how to reconcile fractured family relationships and arm yourself for special events
news.summary: Leaving the hills of Montecito far behind, this week Prince Harry flew into the UK for a four-day visit. Even though he is no longer a working royal, it was filled with speeches, goodwill appearances and photo opportunities.

news.title: Mark Keenan: Government leaves old bedsit buildings to linger in limbo at the cost of thousands of homes
news.summary: There is a way that by a stroke of a pen (and no investment or other effort whatsoever), an Irish Government minister could provide thousands of quality homes in our cities in already serviced areas.

news.title: Who is Maria Steen? Conservative campaigner and mum-of-five who home-schools her children and voted ‘No’ in abortion and equality referendums
news.summary: Conservative campaigner Maria Steen, who is known for her recent role in pushing back against the failed family and care referendums, is making inroads to appearing on the presidential ballot. But it is likely to be an uphill battle for her.

news.title: ‘Habits you build now will compound over time’ – the smartest money moves you can make in your 20s, according to financial experts
news.summary: Billionaire businessman Bill Gates famously said he never took a day off in his 20s. The dedication to work obviously paid off for him but there must be easier ways to make and manage money during those formative years.
